prop.head.label.name: Part
prop.head.headtext: Handling Cases Before the Judicial Panel on Multidistrict Litigation

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Factors in Deciding Whether Transfer Is Appropriate

para.paratext: The Panel considers a wide variety of cases in its work, and ultimately the type of case is relatively unimportant. No special rules apply to any type of action, and to the extent patterns of similar treatment can be discerned, the flow from the similar characteristics of certain types of litigation. Thus securities actions are frequently transferred, but the explanation of this comes not from the fact that securities claims are asserted, but that the cases are numerous, with very common fact issues, and that they are often filed as multiple, competing class actions. These factors are what drives the Panel's decision.

The types of cases transferred reflect the overall complexion of complex cases in the federal courts. In recent years, for example, the Panel's docket includes increasing numbers of Fair Labor Standards Act and overtime pay cases, and insurance and financial service sales practices cases, just as these cases have taken a larger role in federal court dockets around the country.
Maslon Edelman Borman & Brand, LLP, Minneapolis, Minnesota.
